required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Randomized Phase III Trial of Surgery Alone or Surgery Plus Preoperative Gemcitabine-Cisplatin in Early Stages NSCLC
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Phase III Trial of Surgery Alone or Surgery Plus Preoperative Gemcitabine-Cisplatin in Clinical Early Stages(T2N0, T1 - 2N1, T3N0 AND T3N1) Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC)

brief_summary.textblock: Preoperative chemotherapy is considered to play a role in early stage non small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) .The use of preoperative Cisplatin/Gemcitabine chemotherapy has proven feasible and without excessive morbidity or mortality in the Phase II setting. The aim of the present Phase III study is to determine whether 3 cycles of preoperative chemotherapy with Cisplatin/Gemcitabine improves progression free survival of NSCLC patients versus surgery alone. Postoperative chemotherapy will not be utilized in this Phase III trial.

secondary_outcome.measure: To compare the survival and sites of relapse in the two study arms.
Pathologic response rate of tissue samples

intervention.description: 1250 mg/m2, IV, day 1 and 8, q 21 days x 3 cycles
75 mg/m2, IV, q 21 days x 3 cycles

criteria.textblock:
Main inclusion Criteria:
- Must have pathologic documentation of non-small cell lung cancer, IB, II, IIIA.
- ECOG Performance Status of 0 - 1
- Bidimensionally measurable disease or evaluable disease
- Adequate organ function
Main exclusion Criteria:
- Have greater than Grade 1 neuropathy - motor/sensory
- Significant history of cardiac disease
- Pleural effusion

results_reference.citation: Scagliotti GV, Pastorino U, Vansteenkiste JF, Spaggiari L, Facciolo F, Orlowski TM, Maiorino L, Hetzel M, Leschinger M, Visseren-Grul C, Torri V. Randomized phase III study of surgery alone or surgery plus preoperative cisplatin and gemcitabine in stages IB to IIIA non-small-cell lung cancer. J Clin Oncol. 2012 Jan 10;30(2):172-8. doi: 10.1200/JCO.2010.33.7089. Epub 2011 Nov 28.

patient_data.ipd_description: Lilly provides access to the individual patient data from studies on approved medicines and indications as defined by the sponsor specific information on ClinicalStudyDataRequest.com. This access is provided in a timely fashion after the primary publication is accepted. Researchers need to have an approved research proposal submitted through ClinicalStudyDataRequest.com. Access to the data will be provided in a secure data sharing environment after signing a data sharing agreement.
